member.name: T:SoftGear.Strix.Client.Ingame.Interpolation.Vector3
member.summary: A structure encapsulating three single precision floating point values and provides hardware accelerated methods.

member.name: P:SoftGear.Strix.Client.Ingame.Interpolation.Vector3.Zero
member.summary: Returns the vector (0,0,0).

member.name: P:SoftGear.Strix.Client.Ingame.Interpolation.Vector3.One
member.summary: Returns the vector (1,1,1).

member.name: P:SoftGear.Strix.Client.Ingame.Interpolation.Vector3.UnitX
member.summary: Returns the vector (1,0,0).

member.name: P:SoftGear.Strix.Client.Ingame.Interpolation.Vector3.UnitY
member.summary: Returns the vector (0,1,0).

member.name: P:SoftGear.Strix.Client.Ingame.Interpolation.Vector3.UnitZ
member.summary: Returns the vector (0,0,1).

member.name: M:SoftGear.Strix.Client.Ingame.Interpolation.Vector3.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hash code for this instance.

member.name: M:SoftGear.Strix.Client.Ingame.Interpolation.Vector3.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns a boolean indicating whether the given Object is equal to this Vector3 instance.
member.returns: True if the Object is equal to this Vector3; False otherwise.

member.name: M:SoftGear.Strix.Client.Ingame.Interpolation.Vector3.ToString
member.summary: Returns a String representing this Vector3 instance.

member.name: M:SoftGear.Strix.Client.Ingame.Interpolation.Vector3.ToString(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a String representing this Vector3 instance, using the specified format to format individual elements.

member.name: M:SoftGear.Strix.Client.Ingame.Interpolation.Vector3.ToString(System.String,System.IFormatProvider)

member.param: The format provider to use when formatting elements.

member.summary: Returns the length of the vector.

member.name: M:SoftGear.Strix.Client.Ingame.Interpolation.Vector3.LengthSquared
member.summary: Returns the length of the vector squared. This operation is cheaper than Length().
